intro: Bumelia arborescens, commonly known as the white hickory, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes other plants such as poison ivy and mango. The plant is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and alternate, simple, elliptical leaves that turn yellow in the fall. Its flowers are small, greenish-white, and clustered in panicles, followed by small, round, yellowish fruits. Bumelia arborescens is often found in moist, rich soils along stream banks and in woodland edges.
